meanings.definition: A device used to maintain or adjust tension.
meanings.sent1: The tensioner kept the rope taut during the performance.
meanings.sent2: The tensioner on the guitar helped keep the strings in tune.
meanings.sent3: The tensioner, a little gadget, made sure the rubber band didn't snap!
meanings.sent4: She was like a tensioner in the office, always keeping everyone on edge.
meanings.sent5: The tensioner was like a silent guardian, ensuring everything stayed just right.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that causes tension.
meanings.sent1: His constant complaints were a tensioner in the group.
meanings.sent2: The unresolved issue became a tensioner in their relationship.
meanings.sent3: The squeaky door became the tensioner in the quiet library.
meanings.sent4: The looming deadline was a tensioner, making everyone anxious.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds were a tensioner, signaling an impending storm.
